text: The 1970–71 Challenge Cup was the 70th staging of rugby league's oldest knockout competition, the Challenge Cup. replay||Wakefield Trinity || Salford ||8-15 |} ==Second Round== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |- !width=150| Date !width=250| Team One !width=250| Team Two !width=100| Score |- |19 Feb ||Castleford || Keighley ||9-6 |- |20 Feb ||Leeds || St Helens ||4-0 |- |21 Feb ||Dewsbury || Bramley ||13-17 |- |21 Feb ||Featherstone Rovers || Hull FC ||7-7 |- |21 Feb ||Hunslet || Huddersfield ||0-16 |- |21 Feb ||Salford || Warrington ||20-9 |- |21 Feb ||Swinton || Wigan ||8-2 |- |21 Feb ||Widnes || Leigh ||11-14 |- |24 Feb -replay||Hull FC || Featherstone Rovers ||12-8 |} ==Quarter Finals== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |- !width=150| Date !width=250| Team One !width=250| Team Two !width=100| Score |- |06 Mar ||Bramley || Leeds ||0-14 |- |06 Mar ||Castleford || Salford ||9-8 |- |07 Mar ||Huddersfield || Swinton ||11-8 |- |07 Mar ||Leigh || Hull FC ||8-4 |} ==Semi Finals== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |- !width=150| Date !width=250| Team One !width=250| Team Two !width=100| Score |- |27 Mar ||Leeds || Castleford ||19-8 |- |03 Apr ||Leigh || Huddersfield ||10-4 |} ==Final== The final was played on Saturday 15 May 1971, where Leigh beat Leeds 24-7 at Wembley in front of a crowd of 85,514. The winner of the Lance Todd Trophy was Leigh's captain-coach, Alex Murphy who was stretchered off after a clash with Leeds player, Syd Hynes. For his part in the "clash", Hynes was sent off, and became the first player to be sent-off in a Challenge Cup final after the headbutt on Leigh's Murphy. This was Leigh's second Cup Final win in two Final appearances.
